physical_examinations.vital_signs: Blood pressure: 134/68 mm Hg, Pulse: 96 bpm, Temperature: 37.5°C, Respiratory rate: 20 breaths/min, Oxygen saturation: 93%
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Cachectic appearance. Surgical scars and changes from radiation on the neck. Severe pain on palpation of the orbits, temples, and forehead. Neurologic examination showed complete ptosis of the left eyelid and incomplete ptosis of the right eyelid (2 mm corneal exposure), pupils were 6 mm and unresponsive to light. Doll’s-eye maneuver did not produce eye movements. Fluctuating attentiveness.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At initial admission, pain around the right eye and forehead developed with ptosis and diplopia, with temperature rising to 38.3°C. Subsequently, left ophthalmoplegia and bilateral facial swelling progressed with severe generalized facial pain. On day 12, MRI revealed signal abnormality consistent with inflammation and multiple densities in the cerebellum, indicating worsening of the condition.
